attributes.action: Government to amend rules so GPs can charge Solicitors for postage for SAR.
attributes.background: GDPR has put a financial burden of £25 for postage on GP Practices for Subject Access Requests (SAR) for litigation cases from Solicitors. Solicitors are capitalising on this as opposed to requesting Access To Medical Records which carries a fee. GP time to remove sensitive data is not recoverable.
attributes.additional_details:
Historically practices could charge up to £50.00 to cover the consumables and postage charges. 
Solicitors are requesting information under a SAR request despite it clearly being for litigation. Patients are consenting to full medical records which under data protection is excessive in line with the Caldecott principals.

attributes.action: Remove anonymity from MPs accused of misconduct.
attributes.background: MPs have voted to grant themselves anonymity if accused of sexual harassment or expenses misconduct. They will remain anonymous while being investigated – and might not be named even if they are judged guilty.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should not have rights above those of ordinary people. Otherwise, even if they get caught, we may never know.

attributes.action: provide free water for everyone on the street of UK in this extreme hot weather
attributes.background: I think water must be free in this hot weather for everyone specially homeless people living on the street. The government must provide funding to local councils to facilitate the supply of free water in the street on UK. The local government must help local shops to provide water to everyone.
attributes.additional_details: The condition is extremely hot and people can get dehydrated and homeless people are at higher risk. Water must be provided by the local government in form of a water fountain or local shops providing them by local council finding them. This is a government’s duty to keep their people safe.

attributes.action: All Diabetes sufferers should be entitled to free dental treatment
attributes.background: I was diagnosed with Type II Diabetes in 2016. I hadn't required any dental treatment for over 10 years but suddenly felt that my gums were receding. The dentist later told me that diabetic people are very prone to gum disease. Besides free eye tests and feet checks, dental care should be included.
attributes.additional_details:
People with diabetes are at greater risk for dental problems.

They're more likely to have infections of their gums and the bones that hold their teeth in place, because diabetes can reduce the blood supply to the gums.

High blood sugar may also cause dry mouth and make gum disease worse. Less saliva can allow more tooth-decaying bacteria and plaque buildup.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 2 years
attributes.background: We are in the middle of the Brexit process and the government has made no progress at all so far, when we’re about to leave the EU in March next year.  This literally shows that this government is too weak to govern the country and to come to an agreement on terms.
attributes.additional_details: Also, some council elections will be in May 2022, which means the General Election will clash with the council elections and we’re supposed to have one election within this five year timeframe, not more than one.

attributes.action: Abolish International Student Fees and Finance Ineligibility for UK Citizens
attributes.background: The prerequisite three year residence in the UK deprives British citizens from the ability to access Student Finance, meaning that families have to attempt to pay the massive fees on their own. This disadvantages domestic students, and is unfair on those who possess British passports and citizenship
attributes.additional_details: I moved back to the UK from overseas in June 2017, and wish to apply for university in 2019, once I have completed A Levels. I was born in Kings-Lynn, Norfolk, and have possessed a British passport all my life. Having never lived under another nationality, or been a permanent resident of any foreign country, to find out that I am classed as an international student within my own borders is upsetting, and is a disadvantage for me, as I now cannot afford higher education, or find myself a job.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Ban alcohol and gambling sponsors in sport.
attributes.background:
Our nation is getting worse with alcohol and gambling, young children, teens are being exposed to bad influences that it is good to drink alcohol and gamble as it is good to watch sport such as football. Children are seeing this as a norm and have become addicts.
It is time to stop this.

attributes.action: Offer more funding to suicide and self-harm charities.
attributes.background: The rates of suicide and self-harm cases are extremely alarming in present day. Whilst there are charitable organisations trying to combat these issues, there is more than can be done. With the digital age that we currently live in, more can be done to ensure that these charities are being utilised.
attributes.additional_details: Potentially, phone companies being required to install these numbers in people's phone books, mandatory app's with the information. The help is there, but people need to know it's there.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Give all carers with SGO the same allowance regardless of income
attributes.background:
Carers with SGOs keep children out of the care system.  Some of us get an allowance, others don't.  
We get deductions from these allowances, yet we do the same as foster carers who get larger allowances. 
We have the additional issues of emotional attatchement to these children.
attributes.additional_details:
We care for children who have a lot of emotional issues,  we keep them out of the care system because we have a heart and love these children as if they were our own. Yet we get penalised for this, some SGO carers get no help bringing these children up and giving them the life every child deserves.
The government should not make deductions to allowances and should make the allowance the same for every carer regardless of income.

attributes.action: Offer all GCSE, A level and University students a mental health check
attributes.background: Lots of young adults have mental health issues and don't speak out about it and are scared to. To stop this from developing all students should have a mental health check yearly between years 10 to finishing university. This can then get all students the help that they deserve and should have.
attributes.additional_details: School is hard enough to get through and deal with during these stressful times without having disorders and everything holding you down. This can become easier through knowing who has these issues and helping them through the process.

attributes.action: Refund 50% of 2018 car tax to offset the cost to Motorists and Motorbike Riders
attributes.background:
Due to the Extreme weather conditions 
The UK Roads are at their worst condition for years and are filled with potholes and loose chipping that are causing untold damage to suspension and tyres. This heavy cost of repair is a burden. Councils have not carried out repairs so a refund should assist

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Expand the Ancestry Visa to Commonwealth Citizens w/ UK born great grandparents
attributes.background: Currently, the Home Office only allows for Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born grandparent to obtain an ancestry visa. We want to change this and extend this visa to Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born great-grandparent.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have cousins spread across the Commonwealth who still maintain close family connections with us despite the fact that they have been out of the UK for a few generations. If they wish to return to our island, then we should allow them to do so. In addition most of them have a great understanding of our political system and culture, as well conform to our standards. An act such as this will put us in a better position with the Commonwealth and help fill the Brexit labour shortage.

attributes.action: Make homework optional/non-compulsory and ban detention and isolation
attributes.background: Homework stresses young minds out. How are children expected to complete 15 pieces of homework a week for it simply to be glanced at? It is unfair for people to be kept in school against their will, but many schools in the UK do this. Action must be taken!

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have “12 years to limit climate change catastrophe” (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning let’s DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know it’s not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know it’s hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and can’t be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Modernise and Amend The Highways Act of 1835
attributes.background: The Highways Act of 1835 is preventing Tech Startups and Global Business specialising in PLEV's (Personal Light Electronic Vehicle) from trading in the UK. It will also increase capacity of our cities by getting people off public transport and having fewer cars on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see... http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Will4/5-6/50/section/LXXII/enacted

The purpose of this partition is to ask the government to change the law so that PLEV's (Electronic Scooters)can be ridden in public areas. Currently they are banned from both Pavements and Roads. PLEV's are a cost effective environmentally friendly emission free way of getting around a city. PLEV's also need a classification as a vehicle type as a part of this in the same way as Electronic Bikes are classified

attributes.action: Require restaurants to give a range of vegan and vegetarian options by law
attributes.background: As it stands there is no actual law that states restaurants must provide vegan and vegetarian options. Veganism is on the rise and gaining real growth as its own lifestyle. most of us feel unfairly treated when our options are greatly limited and social interactions are in decline as a result
attributes.additional_details:
The other reasons are simple. While I firmly believe killing animals is wrong and that a plant based diet brings great benefits I accept not everyone will change. But I do believe that everyone is happy to try or at least take pressure away from the animal farming industry. 
The killing of animals for food and the use of what they provide has been linked to cancer, diabetes and other awful diseases by some studies. We pay millions in treating these.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. It’s a choice people have.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory GCSE English Literature subject with Computer Science.
attributes.background: An increasing number of jobs require IT and far more than English Literature.

attributes.action: Allow vehicle tax to remain with the vehicle upon transfer of ownership.
attributes.background:
When the DVLA stopped issuing paper tax disc the ability to transfer vehicle tax to a new owner was also removed. 
This means that in many cases the tax is paid by both the seller and buyer for the month the car changes hands.

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: The British people should have a referendum on abolishing the Monarchy.
attributes.background: The British people should be given a referendum to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or become a republic.
attributes.additional_details: The British public should be given a vote to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or not.

attributes.action: Teach schools about emotional & physical wellbeing, mental health & illnesses
attributes.background: I think it is very important that from a young age our children should be taught more about the effects of mental illness and show them a positive outlook on life through physical and emotional wellbeing. This can be yoga, meditation, holistic studies etc. Our children are our future!
attributes.additional_details: As a sufferer of mental illness from a very early age due to family problems & bullying, I think its vital that children should have the opportunity to be more educated on the affects of mental illness as it has such an impact on them in the future. Introducing wellbeing & complementary therapy classes to the curriculum I believe would help a lot of children understand how mental illness works and how to tackle it positively. I strongly believe that emotional and physical wellbeing is crucial.

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all acid that burns the skin on contact
attributes.background: Today I walked into a discount home store and found acid on sale for £1.99. Thousands of lives destroyed for only £1.99.
attributes.additional_details: As a plumber I have used acid before and find it is dangerous even for me to use, even when standing back from it and reaching out to pour it down the drain it can still burn my eyes and face from the fumes. As a result I do not use it for cleaning drains, acid destroys the plug hole and all seals on the pipes. There is no need for it to be used for plumbing. Acids are used in a lot of items from lemons to drain cleaner, however some are diluted and would not cause harm, so i am asking for all acids that burn the skin instantly to be banned outright.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Place a ban on companies demanding experience for 'factory floor' jobs.
attributes.background: Coffee houses, supermarkets, clothes stores and others demand experience to work on tills, stock shelves and make drinks. The average person can cook, clean, hang laundry and treat people decently. So, why do these daily tasks, skills and experiences need to be gained from previous employment?
attributes.additional_details:
If education is the key to a better life, then why is 'work experience' the lock keeping people barren. This may predominantly affect millennials, but it affects others too. There are people who want to work, but get rejected; when they just want to give back to society. 

If I can't obtain a job, due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Yet, to obtain work/job-related experience, I need a job. However, an employer won't hire me; due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Then the system becomes a punishment for those who desire knowledge and to be better & productive members of society.

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least £10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: alter law so that biological parents are legal guardian of their surrogate child
attributes.background: In the UK, the worrying thing about using your own embryo (which is biologically yours and your partners DNA) is that the surrogate is the legal guardian and can keep the child once born, if they decide to. I find this a scary thought after struggling to have my own child and considering surrogacy.
attributes.additional_details: If the embryo is biologically from the couple struggling with fertility and they choose to use a surrogate, there should be a law in place to say that baby is theirs legally and that the surrogate cannot keep the child once born. Couples struggling with infertility have enough to worry about without having their hopes dashed by a surrogate mother who may suddenly decide she doesn't want to part with the child once born, which would be devastating if the couple are biologically the 'real' parents

attributes.action: Support Chez Save A Life Methanol Awareness campaign.
attributes.background: After Cheznye passed away in Thailand in 2013, our family started a campaign to make other tourists aware of the risks of Methanol Poisoning when abroad. After countless discussions with the governmental figures they decided that Methanol Poisoning awareness was not a priority for them.
attributes.additional_details: As a family we have still tried to push Methanol Awareness but alone, our message doesn't spread far enough. 17 more tourists have suffered Methanol Posioning in Zante recently and I don't suspect this will be the last cases unless we create some awareness for tourists. We need support to from our government to raise awareness and save lives.

attributes.action: Condemn the Bangladeshi Government's violent crackdown on student protests.
attributes.background: The protests demanding more stringent road safety, were triggered when 2 students were killed by a speeding bus.The student-led protests are being targeted by state-sponsored violence. Bangladesh's government has also shut down access to mobile internet in many parts of the country in response.
attributes.additional_details:
The Telegraph and the BBC have noted the use of rubber bullets by the police. Online evidence, being shared by the protesters, also point to sexual assault and violent attacks carried out by the student wing of the ruling party, Awami League and the authorities.
Per the WHO, there are 20,000 road fatalities every year in Bangladesh. The government's violent crackdown is thought to be fueled by fears of anti-government sentiments leading up to the general election.

attributes.action: Reduce the eligibility of Police long service medal from 20 to 15 years
attributes.background:
Emergency services especially in current times face dangers day in and day out. But have to wait 5 years longer for any formal recognition.
It is proposed that the long service medal of both the police and fire service should be reduced from 20 years to 15 years exactly like the armed forces.

attributes.action: Free Glasses for anyone who needs them NO MATTER THE AGE! Especially students.
attributes.background: As if being a full time student on a budget isn’t hard enough, as soon as I reached 19 years old I was no longer allowed to receive free glasses. Obviously, this was very annoying seeing as I need them, because of my astigmatism I need special lenses which cost a FORTUNE!
attributes.additional_details: I personally believe that glasses should be free to whoever needs them if they cannot afford them, there should be some sort of scheme, not only the NHS. Appointments are free for students but after that you have to pay between £69-£200 for a pair of glassss not including the extra charges to get special lenses fitted in for anyone with eye deficiencies, like myself. If abortions & sex changes through the NHS are free, why do we have to pay for a pair of glasses? - Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Require CCJs to be sent by recorded post
attributes.background: CCJs are just sent by normal post. If these are not received or sent to a previous address they are just entered against you. This is completely unfair which if you find out you have one, you then have to pay to get it set aside as you had no chance of defence. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: These need to at least be sent by recorded post and not entered if they are not received.

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldn’t be banned. It’s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!
